channel.title: Can somebody please help me? [READ]
channel.description:
When ever i make a webclient even webclient making sites i get this error, error click for details. i get this error no matter what source I use, and don't say what the error is please tell me how to fix it. I'm using PI.
Java Plug-in 1.6.0_31 Using JRE version 1.6.0_31-b05 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User home directory = C:\Users\lol ---------------------------------------------------- c: clear console window f: finalize objects on finalization queue g: garbage collect h: display this help message l: dump classloader list m: print memory usage o: trigger logging q: hide console r: reload policy configuration s: dump system and deployment properties t: dump thread list v: dump thread stack x: clear classloader cache 0-5: set trace level to ---------------------------------------------------- load: class client.class not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

item.title: Can somebody please help me? [READ]
item.dc:creator: @TiVo TiVo
item.description:
@TiVo wrote:

Oh yeah, I always forget to compile.

Oh, I see you edited your title and post. :3 Nice

Read full topic

item.title: Can somebody please help me? [READ]
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

snaper:

dude ive searched google and it doesnt tell me properly and if i treat you with respect no answers me and if i treat you poorly everyone gives me answers and dont tell people to search google because whats the point of a help section in the forum.

You are incorrect. There are so many questions that people have when setting up Java. It’s not that Google doesn’t tell you properly, it’s the fact that you do not know how to search properly. Moparscape encourages you to search before asking a question. Probably has already been answered thousands of times.

Read full topic

item.title: Can somebody please help me? [READ]
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“TiVo, post:10, topic:439054”]Even though you’re a total douche, I’ll help you.

First, uninstall jdk and jre

Next, download the LATEST version of jdk

Then, down the LATEST version of jre

Re-jar your client, remember to add the client class in there

Re-sign your client too.

Upload the HTML code from the tutorial you used to your preferred website.

Taadaa.[/quote]

Compile, the jar, just to make it clear.

Off topic: YAY TEAM ROCKET IS BACK

Read full topic

Next, download the LATEST version of jdk

Then, down the LATEST version of jre

Re-jar your client, remember to add the client class in there

Re-sign your client too.

Upload the HTML code from the tutorial you used to your preferred website.

Taadaa.

item.title: Can somebody please help me? [READ]
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

This isn’t a spoonfed community, we told you what was wrong and you just said “wtf you mother fucking feeklefuckers tell me how to fucking fix this fucking error!!!” Google and even Yahoo answers are there to help you, we just point you in the direction to fix it. Also, if you treat us poorly, it’s doubtful that we’ll help you.

Team_Rocket:

Yeah I’m back.

Oh god…

Read full topic

item.title: Can somebody please help me? [READ]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:4, topic:439054”]YAY ITS TEAM ROCKET!

@OP, If you don’t know how to “fucking fix it” , then perhaps you should study on classpath and environment variables? Study Java before you mess around with private servers. Also, use Google, it’s your friend. No need to post this problem which has been answered thousands of times on other programming forums.[/quote]

Yeah I’m back.

@OP, insert what I put in the tag before it uses the class.

Read full topic
